lines.text: [last lines]
[Montag fails to kill Sherry, who laughs maniacally after being disenboweled]
How dare you laugh! HOW DARE YOU!

[sits up]
Look at ME now if you dare! Look into MY eyes!

[goes uneasy]
What will I see there?
The past... and the future. Do you think you're the only one who deals an illusion?
You mean... you? You too?
I, too. And you... you are my illusion. You are no longer even here. You'll have to start your little charade all over again.

[stunned]
But I... I... I am Montag!
[Montag suddenly finds himself back on stage all the way back to the beginning of the movie]
Yes! I am Montag, master of illusion! The fire of the laws of reason! What... is real? Are you certain you know what reality is?
[Sherry and Jack are seen within the audience]
How do you know that at this second you aren't sleeping in your beds dreaming that you are here sitting in this theater?

[whispers to Jack]
You know what I think?
What?
I think he's a phony.
[first lines]
"Oh what clever tricks he has. What a sly deceiver"... and go to sleep in the security of your own, real world.
[laughs]

What is real? Are you certain you know what reality is? How do you know that at this second you aren't asleep in your beds dreaming that you are here in this theater? Ah, yes... it all seems too real. Well, haven't you ever had a dream that seems so very real... until you woke up? Then again, how do you know that you ever did wake up? In fact, perhaps when you thought you were waking up... you had actually just begun to dream! You see what I mean, don't you? All you lives... your pasts... your rules of what can or cannot be may all be part of one long dream from which you are about to awaken and discover the world as it really is!
Half gin and half vermouth. We'll sprinkle the vermouth over a female toad and we'll drink the gin.
Let's go.
